thread.title: Winks 'over the moon' after signing Tottenham deal
thread.title_full: Winks 'over the moon' after signing Tottenham deal

title: Winks 'over the moon' after signing Tottenham deal
text:
0 Feb 14, 2017 12:29:09 Spurs have secured the services of their highly-rated midfielder for the next five seasons after seeing him make a first-team breakthrough this term 
Midfielder Harry Winks is excited about his future at Tottenham after signing a new contract at White Hart Lane until 2022. 
The 21-year-old has broken into the first team under Mauricio Pochettino this season and scored his first Premier League goal as Spurs beat West Ham 3-2 in November. 
WATCH: Eriksen's Ajax highlights 
Though primarily used as a substitute, Winks' growing importance to Spurs was underlined by Tuesday's news of his long-term deal. We are delighted to announce that @HarryWinks has signed a new contract with the Club until 2022. #COYS pic.twitter.com/SGGVXAocnX â€” Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) February 14, 2017 
"I'm delighted, I'm over the moon to sign another contract with the club, commit myself to the future even more and I'm looking forward to the upcoming years," he told Spurs TV . 
"I've been for Tottenham since I was six, but I feel like I'm gradually getting into more of an important role in terms of coming off the bench and getting games as well. 
Dier: We will fight until the very end 
"I always say when you're rewarded with a new contract you've got to keep working hard and justify why you got that, so that's my intention now. 
"I've got to focus on the pitch now, focus on helping the team get the results and hopefully we can push on in these next few weeks, get maximum points and do really well." Related
